definition: to answer questions (as teacher or consultant)/to clarify doubts

sentences.english: This article reports a quantitative dynamical model of a real-time network-connected system for question answering.
sentences.chinese: 报道一个实时在线答疑教学系统的定量动力学模型。

sentences.english: We always think there’s some “authority” out there who can give us the answer.
sentences.chinese: 我们常以为有专家能够答疑解惑。

sentences.english: A segmentation algorithm without dictionary based on network-oriented natural language question answering system is proposed.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一种面向网络答疑系统的无词典分词方法。

sentences.english: Below is an announcement for a Wokai event in Beijing tomorrow and a Q&A .
sentences.chinese: 下面是“我开”在北京举办的一次活动的通告和答疑。

sentences.english: A total of 3300 staff and volunteers will be in place to provide help for subway passengers.
sentences.chinese: 3300名工作人员及志愿者将为乘客购票答疑解惑。

definition: to dispel doubts/to clear up confusion
to give guidance/to mentor/to counsel/to coach/to tutor
to give a lecture/to lecture on
school begins/give a course/teach a subject
tutorial/period of tuition for one or two students

dried food (including dried fruits, mushrooms and seafoods such as shrimp and abalone)/(fig.) (coll.) knowledge presented in readily assimilable form/just what you want to know: no more, no less (no 水分[shui3 fen1])
